title: Someone must know this font!
content:
It seems pretty recognizable  
I’ll attach another just in case the first one doesn’t get Id’d

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 26.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905084023/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%2026_1.png) | 8.02 KB |
| [Picture 16.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905084023/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%2016_0.png) | 13.69 KB |

 [‹ What Typeface is this?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905084023/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43393 "Go to previous forum topic") [little help here... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905084023/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43459 "Go to next forum topic")
author: scarchord

comments.content: The nike women logo uses [FF Dax Wide light](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905084023/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-dax/wide-light/)

The Graphite logo is custom drawn. As for bold, modern unicase faces, you might like [ARS District](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905084023/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/arstype/ars_district_bold/?sample_text=GRaPHITe&sample_size=74).

Hi Rob, closest I have seen to for the Graphite logo is LIW bold, designed by Andreas Pihlström, Suprb

[http://typisc.com/fonts/liw-b](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905084023/http:/typisc.com/fonts/liw-b "http://typisc.com/fonts/liw-b")
